summary: This is an email chain from June 2020 among federal prosecutors discussing a draft indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails show coordination on revisions, scheduling calls to discuss legal questions (specifically 'over acts'), and the circulation of the draft document.

events.title: Email Circulation of Revised Maxwell Indictment Draft
events.description: A revised draft of the Ghislaine Maxwell indictment, adding additional details and addressing prior comments, is circulated among prosecutors via email.

events.title: Scheduled Call on 'Over Acts' Question
events.description: A call is scheduled among legal team members to discuss the legal question regarding 'over acts' in the Maxwell indictment.

keyFacts: The document is a series of emails from June 2020 among federal prosecutors (USANYS - U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York).
The subject is the drafting and revision of a criminal indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The emails show active collaboration, with a revised draft being circulated on June 18, 2020, that added details and addressed prior comments.
A specific legal issue to be discussed was the question of 'over acts' in the indictment.
All personal names in the email headers and bodies are redacted, appearing only as placeholders like '(USANYS)' or blank fields.
